intro: Blastus dunnianus var. glandulosetosus, commonly known as the hairy spiny blastus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine, stiff hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in warm, humid environments. Due to its unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated as an ornamental plant.
